document.masterDocTitle: Loeblibatrus Yin, a New Genus of Myrmecophilous Pselaphinae (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae) from Southern China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Loeblibatrus Yin, a New Genus of Myrmecophilous Pselaphinae (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae) from Southern China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type Species.
Loeblibatrus yunnanus Yin
, new species , by monotypy.
Diagnosis. Medium-sized batrisite with the following features: pronotum and elytra strongly

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 1.
Loeblibatrus yunnanus
, male. A) Dorsal habitus, B) Head and pronotum, C) Abdomen, dorsolateral view, showing spatulate setae. Scale bars = 0.5 mm in A; 0.2 mm in B–C.

Fig. 2. Diagnostic features of
Loeblibatrus yunnanus
(A–G, J: female, H–I: male). A) Head, ventral view, B) Head, lateral view, C) Labrum, showing presence of four thickened setae (arrows) at the anterior margin, D) Left antenna, E) Prosternite, F) Left elytron, G) Meso- and metaventrites, H) Aedeagus, dorsal view, I) Aedeagus, lateral view, J) Genital complex. Abbreviations: cl = clypeus; gf = gular fovea; la = labrum; lmcf = lateral mesocoxal fovea; lmsf = lateral mesoventral fovea; lpcf = lateral procoxal fovea; ma = mandible; mmsf = median mesoventral fovea; omc = ocular-mandibular carina. Scale bars = 0.2 mm in A–B, D, E–G; 0.1 mm in H–J; 0.05 mm in C.

Fig. 3. A)
Loeblibatrus yunnanus
, lateral habitus, B) Distribution of
L . yunnanus
in Yunnan, southern China, C) Host ant,
Ectomomyrmex sp.
(left: lateral habitus; right: head, dorsal view), D) Site where individuals were collected from an
Ectomomyrmex
ant colony under stones (arrows). Scale bars = 0.5 mm in A, 2 mm in C.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology. The new generic name is dedicated to Ivan Löbl ( Geneva , Switzerland ), a renowned entomologist in beetle systematics and taxonomy, and combined with an arbitrary abbreviation of
Batrisus Aubé
, the type genus of the Batrisitae . Gender is masculine.

Loeblibatrus yunnanus Yin
, new species
Zoobank.org/
urn:lsid:zoobank.org:act: B5561AF9-9574-47B8-9900-8E5D6D636638
( Figs. 1–3 )

8 ♀♀ .
Holotype : CHINA :
³, labeled “China: Yunnan , Baoshan City (保山市), Tengchong County (腾冲县), Mingguang Town (明光镇), Zizhi Villege (自治村), 25°42′29″N , 98°35′02″E ,
2300 m
,
30.iv2013
, Dai , Song , Peng leg. [one
Ectomomyrmex Mayr
ant pinned under holotype ]” (in SNUC )
.
Paratypes : CHINA :
1 ³
,
4 ♀♀ , same collecting data as the holotype ( one ♀ paratype was cleared and completely disarticulated and preserved in Euparal on plastic slides)
;
1 ♀ , also from Zizhi , except “ 25°42′48″N , 98°34′53″E ,
2183 m
,
27.iv2013
”
;
1 ♀ , also from Zizhi , except “ 25°42′55″N , 98°34′52″E ,
2100 m
,
1.v.2013
, X.B. Song leg.”
;
2 ♀♀ , labeled “ China : Yunnan , Lincang City (临沧市), Yun County (云县), Manwan Town (漫湾镇), Caozidi Villege (草子地村), 24°40′27″N , 100°23′09″E ,
1757 m
,
2.iv.2016
, Zi-Chun Xiong leg.” (all in SNUC )
.
Diagnosis. As for the genus ( vide supra ), plus antennomeres I–VII each elongate,VIII–X subquadrate, and aedeagus with apically narrowed median lobe.

Description. Male ( Fig.1A ). BL = 1.85–1.89 mm . Body reddish brown, maxillary palpi and tarsi lighter in color. Head ( Figs. 1B , 2A–B ) subtriangular, HL = 0.35–0.36 mm , HW = 0.38 mm ; surface with squamous microsculpture; vertex slightly convex, foveae below level of posterior margins of eyes, faint median carina extending from head base for short distance, ending at level of posterior margin of eyes; eyes ( Figs. 1B , 2B ) small, semicircular, each composed of about 30 small facets; postocular margins longer than eye length, rounded, narrowing from eyes toward base; antennomeres ( Fig. 2D ) I–VII each elongate, VIII–X subrectangular, XI largest. Pronotum ( Fig. 1B ) with round lateral margins, slightly wider than long, PL = 0.37–0.38 mm , PW = 0.39–0.40 mm , disc with squamelliform microsculpture. Elytra subtrapezoidal, strongly constricted at base; slightly wider than long, EL = 0.66–0.69 mm , EW = 0.71–0.73 mm ; foveae and striae totally reduced. All legs elongate, simple. Abdomen wider than long, AL = 0.46–0.47 mm , AW = 0.62–0.65 mm , narrowed posteriorly. Aedeagus ( Fig. 2H–I ) elongate, length 0.25 mm , with large basal capsule and apically narrowed median lobe.

Female. Externally similar to male, except eyes slightly smaller than in male, each composed of about 25 facets. Measurements: BL = 1.84–1.93 mm ; HL = 0.36–0.37 mm ; HW = 0.37–0.38 mm ; PL = 0.38 mm ; PW = 0.41 mm ; EL = 0.67–0.70 mm ; EW = 0.73–0.75 mm ; AL = 0.42– 0.09 mm ; AW = 0.66–0.70 mm ; width of genital complex ( Fig. 2J ) = 0.25 mm .

Host Ant.
Ectomomyrmex sp.
( Fig. 3C ; identified by Hao Ran).

Distribution and Habitat. This species is currently known only from western Yunnan , China ( Fig. 3B ). All individuals from Tengchong were collected in colonies of an
Ectomomyrmex
ant beneath stones ( Fig. 3D ).
Etymology. The new species is named after Yunnan Province , where the type locality is located.
